disease_info.summary: An epidermoid cyst is a small, benign bump beneath the skin.  When infected, they become swollen, red, tender, and may drain pus. They arise from the epidermis, the outer layer of skin.
precautions: Keep the area clean and dry.
Avoid squeezing or picking at the cyst.
Apply warm compresses to help reduce pain and swelling.

medications.purpose: Treat the bacterial infection causing the inflammation of the cyst.

medications.notes: Take with food. Do not exceed recommended dosage.

additional_notes: Follow-up appointment recommended in 1 week. If symptoms worsen or do not improve within 7 days, contact your doctor.
